main.title: Really Important Explanation
main.message: Here I am explaining an incredibly important and interesting idea.

main.title: Efficiency Concerns: When to Include an ORCT?
main.question: What is the airspeed of a fully laden swallow?
main.answer: What, do you mean an African or European swallow?

main.title: I didn't include the likelihoods of the observed rolls e.g. p(X=6|F) = 1/6.
main.message: Gadzooks, promise me you won't ever make that mistake again!

main.title: I thought p(6|F)=0.5.
main.message: Please don't be mean to the number 6.

main.title: I thought the set of paths would be all possible dice rolls 111, 112, 113, ... 666.
main.message: Go back and read the book from page 1 to the end.

main.title: Where did the 6,2, and 10 come from in the beginning of each probability?
main.question: I understand the fractions and where those probabilities came from but where did the 6s, 2s, and 10s come from?
main.answer: 1/6 is the likelihood of any roll outcome under the F state. 1/2 is the likelihood of rolling a six under the L state.  1/10 is the likelihood of any other outcome (i.e. anything but a six) under the L state.  Note that the question explicitly asked you to calculate the joint probability of both the observed rolls and the hidden states (not JUST the hidden states).

main.title: Why did I think 266 was two hundred and sixty six?
main.question: I have a really important question and was wondering will you answer it?

updates.title: I didn't realize that the answer to this question would change my life.
updates.message: Here is the amazing true story that will change your life forever!

updates.title: Please, Professor, can you explain exactly what I am confused about?
updates.question: I am a student who is very confused, and am hoping that you can make everything clear to me.
updates.answer: I, the instructor, am now answering your question in great detail: yada yada yada.
